result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua James Stirdivant

records.addlTxt: 9:06 AM Defendant Joshua James Stirdivant appeared by phone.  Attorney Jacob Birenbaum appeared by phone for Joshua James Stirdivant.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim makes statement. Victim's request through the State to amend contact condition of bond. State objects to the defendant moving back into the home but does support contact in a counseling setting. Court denies the bond motion at this time.
Bail/bond hearing on October 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
to Address Non-Monetary Conditions of Bond Based on the Victim's Request
